entries.text: Let’s start off talking about the robots. They live in cages, they travel at 60mph, and they’re controlled via AMQ messages from a Perl-based Warehouse Management System. Simultaneously awesome and terrifying, they work tirelessly to move expensive dresses around such exotic locations as Charlton, and Mahwah, New Jersey. Be filled with an incredible sense of power and agency as you send their giant metal bodies hurling around the warehouse. Alternatively, you might end up working on the code that makes the printers work.
entries.title: Work with giant, caged robots, and Perl; Senior Developer, West London

entries.text: Not everyone’s like me. Perhaps nobody’s like me. But when it comes to enjoying programming jobs, and particularly when it comes to enjoying Perl programming jobs, there are two things that are needed to make me happy that I suspect resonate with most other career developers.
entries.title: Two Things that Make Developers Happy - Mid-to-Senior Perl Developer in London

entries.text: They say that curiosity killed the cat, but here at Perl Careers we’ve found that quite the opposite is true. Dabbling in something new can often lead to great things - Pete’s transition from full time developer to full time recruiter over the last four years is a case in point. While developers are always solving problems in creative ways or experimenting with new software and tools, sometimes that doesn’t quite cut it and a bigger change may be needed to satiate the chronically curious.
entries.title: Ready set Go…lang, for a new telecommute career – Opportunity for a Perl developer to learn Go (from home)

header: The Perl Conference 2018 in Salt Lake City, Utah is just around the corner.
They have arranged plenty of sessions, tutorials and lightning talks.
There is still time to submit proposal for Lightning Talk.
If you are willing to volunteer then please Sign Up.
Following this conference, next in line is The Perl Conference in Glasgow from 14th-17th Aug 2018.
Enjoy reading this week newsletter. Don't forget to send your suggestions so that we can serve the community better.
